page.title: 10THE SADDLER AT DRAYCOTT
page.content: WE WENT TO THE {SADDLERS}IN {DRAYCOTT} AND SAW A NEWSPAPER CUTTING ABOUT COATS WHICH HE HAD MADE FOR BABY ELEPHANTS AT LONGLEAT. WE SAW MANY THINGS WHICH HE MAKES FROM LEATHER WHICH COMES FROM A TANNERY IN DEVON SUCH AS{SADDLES}AND{BRIDLES.}IT TAKES ABOUT 25 HOURS TO MAKE A SADDLE. IT IS NOT ONLY LEATHER WORK FOR HORSES WHICH IS MADE BUT FANCY WORK FOR CIRCUS ANIMALS USING COLOURED LEATHERS AND DIAMANTE. HE STITCHES BY HAND USING THREAD RUBBED IN BEES WAX AND ALSO MAKES PATTERNS WITH FANCY STITCHING AND LEATHER THONGS. HE REPAIRS ARICLES AS WELL AS MAKING NEW ONES, HE IS VERY SKILFUL AND VERY CLEVER AND IS A MEMBER OF THE {SOCIETY {OF MASTER SADDLERS.} HIS WORKS GOES ALL OVER THE WORLD FROM THE SMALL WORKSHOP IN OUR VILLAGE.
